content:
I don't have much experience with gitpod (or gitpod flex?), but it seems like a useful tool, and perhaps an easy way for people to engage with Lean code without downloading it.

I know that, for example the FLT project is enabled for gitpod.
I'm considering enabling it for HepLean.

I have two questions:

  1. Is there any negatives to doing this, or any reason I shouldn't?
  2. Are there any good resources on how to set up gitpod for a Lean project? (I couldn't find anything on this Zulip).

(In general I am interested in other ways people can interactive with code in HepLean without downloading having to download Lean. I know that https://live.lean-lang.org is an option but I'm not sure how to use it for a large multi-file project which is not Mathlib.)

I use it for the module that I teach and I find it really useful. Setting it up for me was basically copy-pasting a file from mathlib and it "just worked".

The repo for my course is here and the relevant file should be this one.
Damiano, there is now a better way than having your own dockerfile
Here is the one file you need to add to your project
Oh, I actually have a version of that file in my repository as well. Are you saying that the other file is redundant?
Also, the VSCode installation that I get already comes with ErrorLens: is this the case for the one that comes with the file that you mention?

Damiano Testa said:

Also, the VSCode installation that I get already comes with ErrorLens: is this the case for the one that comes with the file that you mention?

Extensions are mostly orthogonal to the dockerfile. You can add Error Lens here
Ok, thanks! I am surprised that I have ErrorLens by default, then...
Maybe it is a setting that I added globally to my gitpod account?
It might be that you synced your settings and extensions with your github account
Sorry, I'm single-handed for the time being
Yes, maybe it is some syncing: I cannot find extensions in gitpod directly.
Anyway, now that the course is ongoing, I will not change the gitpod setup, but I will experiment with it, once term finishes!

Damiano Testa said:

Oh, I actually have a version of that file in my repository as well. Are you saying that the other file is redundant?

Yes, exactly. Those lines point to your dockerfile, but they could instead point to the dockerhub image created from that dockerfile (or rather the identical one in mathlib)

Yaël Dillies said:

Here is the one file you need to add to your project

The above will teach you that that image is called leanprovercommunity/gitpod4
... and not leanprovercommunity/gitpod as the dockerfile claims. PR welcome!
@Yaël Dillies 's suggestion seemed to work. Many thanks both!
